data.title: Equinor Reduces Investment Outlook to Renewables and Low Carbon Solutions
Analysts Saw Santander 4Q Revenue at EUR15.39B
Analysts Saw Santander 4Q Net Profit at EUR2.95B
State Power Rixin Technology Gets Chinese Securities Regulator's Nod For Share Issue
data.description:
State Power Rixin Technology said it received approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission to issue shares to specific investors, according to a Wednesday filing with the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.

The approval is valid for 12 months, requiring strict compliance with the reported issuance plan. The company must report any major developments before completion. The board will proceed with the issuance and ensure compliance.

The company's shares were up by over 2% in recent trading.

data.title: Windey Energy Tech Gets Chinese Securities' Nod to Issue Shares; Shares Drop 4%
data.description:
Windey Energy Technology Group obtained approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission to issue shares to certain investors, according to a Shenzhen Stock Exchange filing on Tuesday.

The details of the issuance are yet to be disclosed, but the regulator's approval is valid within 12 months, the Chinese wind turbine manufacturer said.

The company's shares dropped less than 4% in recent trade.

data.title: LG Energy Solution Shares Rise 3.9% to KRW346,000
LG Energy Advances After S Korea Plans New State Fund to Support Battery Industry
Equinor Lowers Expected Capacity in Renewables
Japan 10-Year Yield Scales Fresh 14-Year Highs
data.description:
Japan’s 10-year government bond yield rose to around 1.29% on Wednesday, reaching its highest level in nearly 14 years as strong wage and services data bolstered expectations of a hawkish stance from the Bank of Japan.

Data showed that real wages in Japan rose for the second consecutive month in December, with nominal wage growth hitting a near three-decade high, driven by a surge in winter bonuses.

Japan’s services PMI for January was also revised upward to 53, from an initial reading of 52.7.

The Bank of Japan raised interest rates in January and has signaled its readiness to hike rates further if economic and price trends align with its forecasts.

Externally, safe-haven demand for government bonds eased as escalating global trade tensions turned out to be less severe than expected.

data.title: Santander's Q4 net profit up 11% compared to same period in 2023
data.description:
Spain's Santander said on Wednesday its net profit in the fourth quarter rose 11% compared to the same period in 2023 thanks to a solid performance at its retail business in Europe, mainly in Spain, and in Brazil.

One of the three biggest lenders in the euro zone by market value booked a net profit of 3.27 billion euros ($3.39 billion) in the quarter.

Analysts polled by Reuters expected Santander to book a net profit of 2.93 billion euros.

($1 = 0.9638 euros)

data.title: Santander 4Q-End Fully-Loaded CET1 Ratio 12.8%
India's JK Tyre skids to 15-month low as profit drops again
data.description:
** Shares of JK Tyre drop as much as 5% to 297.65 rupees, lowest since Oct. 2023

** Tyre maker reports lower profit for second straight qtr on weak demand from truck and bus customers, margin hit from higher raw material costs

** Trading volume on the day is heaviest in nearly two months, with volumes 4.3x the 30-day avg

** JKIN is rated "buy" on avg by four brokerages, median PT is 490 rupees - LSEG data

** Stock last down 2.6%, taking YTD drop to ~21%; broader Nifty 500 (.NIFTY500) has dropped ~2% YTD

data.title: Sasol sees up to 36% drop in half-yearly profit on lower oil prices
data.description:
South African petrochemical firm Sasol forecast a fall of up to 36% in half-yearly earnings on Wednesday, mainly due to a decline in oil prices and lower sales volumes.

Sasol said in a trading update that it expects its headline earnings per share (HEPS), a profit measure widely used in South Africa, to come in between 13 rand and 15 rand ($0.6955-$0.8025), down from 20.37 rand in the same period last year.

The company, which produces chemicals and liquid fuels from coal and gas, said the decline was primarily because of a 13% fall in the average rand Brent crude oil price per barrel, as well as a significant drop in refining margins and fuel price differentials.

A 5% decrease in sales volumes due to lower production and market demand also hurt income, Sasol said.

The company will release its half-yearly results on Feb. 24.

($1 = 18.6923 rand)

data.title: Balady Poultry Announces Its Strategic Expansion Plan
data.description:
BALADY POULTRY TRADING :

  • ANNOUNCES ITS STRATEGIC EXPANSION PLAN

  • AIMS CONSTRUCTION OF 600 BROILER CHICKEN COOPS

  • AIMS TO INVEST IN THE POULTRY SECTOR IN THE AMOUNT OF SAR 1.13 BILLION

  • TO ESTABLISH 2 HATCHING HATCHERIES WITH AN ANNUAL CAPACITY OF 100 MILLION SAUCES PER HATCHERY

  • TO ESTABLISH 1-A SLAUGHTERHOUSE AND A FACTORY FOR THE PRODUCTION OF POULTRY MEAT AND ITS FACTORIES WITH A PRODUCTION CAPACITY OF 500 THOUSAND BIRDS PER DAY

data.title: Equinor Q4 profit slightly beats expections
data.description:
Equinor on Wednesday posted slightly higher-than-expected profits for the final quarter of 2024.

The Norwegian oil and gas producer's adjusted earnings before tax for October-December fell to $7.90 billion from $8.56 billion a year earlier, beating the $7.71 billion predicted in a poll of 24 analysts compiled by Equinor.

data.title: Santander Targets 2025 Return on Tangible Equity of More Than 17%
S Korea Fin Min Was Speaking at Meeting With Relevant Ministers in Seoul
Fitch Says Trump's Trade Policy to Be 'More Aggressive' Than Expected
data.description:
Fitch Ratings expects that US President Donald Trump will deploy "a much more aggressive trade policy" than its baseline assumptions, following the introduction of new global tariffs, the credit ratings firm said in its report published Tuesday.

The 10% tariff hike on China's imported goods was lower than the previously planned 60% hike, but Fitch said these tariffs may further increase this year, with China being subject to US trade investigations.

The White House also introduced a 25% tariff on Mexican imports and 10% on Canadian energy resources, but the implementation was delayed for another month for further negotiations, the report said.

Interest groups in the US warned of the levies' negative consequences, Fitch said, as this new trade policy is likely to put a significant risk to the credit ratings firm's macro-economic forecasts for China, Mexico and Canada.

data.title: VRX Silica Says Western Australia Silica Sand Project Faces Appeal During Environmental Approval
data.description:
VRX Silica said an appeal was filed during the environmental approval process for the Arrowsmith North silica sand development proposal, according to a Wednesday Australian bourse filing.

The Conservation Council of WA filed the appeal during a three-week review period after the Environmental Protection Authority of Western Australia published an assessment report for the firm's proposal and recommended to the environment minister that it may be implemented.

The appeal will be investigated by the Office of the Appeals Convenor on behalf of the minister, who will ultimately determine the appeal, the filing said.

The firm is preparing its response to the appeal, set to be filed by March 3, per the filing.

The firm's shares fell 17% on Wednesday's close.

data.title: KEDE Numerical Control Receives 69 Million Yuan in Government Subsidies
data.description:
KEDE Numerical Control obtained 69.1 million yuan in government subsidies.

These include three national project subsidies totaling 56.9 million yuan and three provincial project subsidies totaling 12.2 million yuan, according to a Wednesday filing with the Shanghai bourse.

Shares of the computer numerical control system provider climbed more than 1% in recent trade.

data.title: JGB yields hit fresh multi-year highs as rising wages drive BOJ's rate hike bets
data.description:
Japanese government bond (JGB) yields hit new multi-year highs on Wednesday after government data showed a rise in wages, bolstering chances of further interest rate hikes.

The 10-year JGB yield (JP10YTN=JBTC) rose to 1.295%, its highest since April 2011, and was last at 1.29%, up 1.5 basis points (bps) from the previous session.

The two-year JGB yield (JP2YTN=JBTC), sensitive to the Bank of Japan's monetary policy, rose 2 bps to 0.76%, its highest since October 2008.

"The market sees declines of JGB yields are limited as they see the BOJ will keep raising interest rates, and that hurt appetite for JGBs," said Takafumi Yamawaki, head of Japan rates research at J.P. Morgan Securities.

Japan's inflation-adjusted real wages rose 0.6% year-on-year in December due to a wintertime bonus bump, marking a second consecutive monthly gain, with government officials expressing optimism that the momentum is growing.

Wage hikes are considered a key factor for the BOJ to raise rates. However, the market is divided about how far the policy rate will rise, making it hard for investors to buy JGBs.

The five-year yield (JP5YTN=JBTC) rose 2.5 bps to 0.95%, its highest since November 2008, before easing to 0.94%.

The 20-year JGB yield (JP20YTN=JBTC) rose 1 bp to 1.995%.

The 30-year JGB yield (JP30YTN=JBTC) rose 0.5 bps to 2.33%.

The 40-year JGB yield (JP40YTN=JBTC) fell 0.5 bps to 2.675%.

Separately, Kazuhiro Masaki, director-general of the BOJ's monetary affairs department, told parliament that the central bank will continue to raise rates if underlying inflation accelerates toward its 2% target as projected.
